data.title: Ignore updates for built-in extensions
Snippet variables overriding previous text
data.body:
When you create a snippet where Variables are directly connected the last variable overrides parts of the first one.
- VSCode Version: 1.5.3
- OS Version: Microsoft Windows [Version 6.1.7601]

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Use the attached snippet for C#
2. In a C# file type example and press TAB
3. For the ${eg} variable enter test
4. For the ${var} variable enter variables

As you can see the text _test_ of the second appearance of ${eg} will partly be overriden by the second appearance of ${var}

![snippet](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7260053/18781440/037b890c-8182-11e6-9361-3abb19eb171e.gif)

``` json
{
    "Example": {
        "prefix": "example",
        "body": [
            "// This is an ${eg} what happens when two ${var}",
            "// are directly connected: ${eg}${var}"
        ]
    }
}
```

data.title: Bash shell overwrites itself when window set to half screen
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.5.3 (5be4091987a98e3870d89d630eb87be6d9bafd27, 2016-09-22T08:50:42.185Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 10.0.14931

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Open code
2. Set bash as your terminal, then laun terminal window
3. pin code to half of your screen (drag to right of window)
4. Start typing a line of code i.e. bash -n debug_03.sh one two
5. The last part of the line of text will overwrite the start of the line of text..  i.e. root@g.. become one two@...

This is only intermittent :(

data.title: Extension published, tested, uploaded, refuses to install - "not found".
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.5.3
- OS Version: Windows 10

I wrote a simple extension today and published it for use. 1.0.0 apparently published successfully and appeared on the marketplace and in the extensions list, but attempts to install it failed, as per this issue. I then wondered if the publish had silently failed somehow, so I published a minor 1.0.1 update, and that seemed to work. After I used it for a few minutes, I found a minor issue that I wrote a small fix for, and then published a 1.0.2 update, and though it appeared in the marketplace as it should, I was unable to update from 1.0.1. After I restarted vs code, the extension failed to load at all and I discovered that the extension folder had only a manifest file and none of the other files in the extension package. I tried then installing it from the command line and got an HTTP 500 error.

I then tried unpublishing and republishing, to no avail. I also tried updating the version to 1.0.3 and though the publish appeared to complete successfully, VS Code refuses to download and install it locally. I have verified with a friend who lives in different country and uses a different OS, and he is experiencing the same issue.

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Verify that the extension exists in the marketplace: https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/items?itemName=NathanRidley.autotrim
2. Try to install it in vs code ("autotrim")
3. Error: "extension not found"
4. Try installing from command line
5. "Extension 'NathanRidley.autotrim' not found."

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/298883/18776079/126ca270-81aa-11e6-8100-ba6db800cf78.png)

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/298883/18776179/d0ca7dc8-81aa-11e6-907a-dff7233dd266.png)

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/298883/18776189/e52d2fcc-81aa-11e6-990b-f01070321626.png)

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/298883/18776199/fb44c0ae-81aa-11e6-9250-58260f165f78.png)

data.title: filename w/ space in front under the EXPLORER does't display correctly
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.5.2 (66f37fd2a99eb9d628dd374d81d78835b410c39b, 2016-09-12T13:22:54.636Z)
- OS Version: Linux x64 4.4.0-38-generic

Steps to Reproduce:
1. g++ -o formattest in tasks.json will create the executable named " formattest" (one space before f)
   but g++ -oformattest in tasks.json will create the executable named "formattest" (no space before f)
2. these both executables are displayed with no difference under the EXPLORER -> foldername, so
   I can't distinguish both different executables.
   the former executable " formattest" should be displayed one indent on screen because it has one
   space before f character in filename.
   many developers make mistake when building c/c++ program using -o option with g++/gcc
   some people use it with one space after -o like -o formattest, in this case, it will create " formattest" executable filename.

anyway, Linux OS can have a executable filename w/ space in front.
But, VSCode may overlook this...

data.title: Show recently opened folders from windows taskbar
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.5.3
- OS Version: Windows 10 Home (1607)

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Have Windows OS
2. Pin VSCode to taskbar
3. Open and close multiple folders
4. Right click VSCode taskbar icon
5. Notice no recently opened folders/files :(

And it would be cool if shift-clicking the taskbar icon would open another instance. But that's even more minor than this minor feature request.

Great Job on it so far though! Loving it!

data.title: Markdown, angle brackets in table not shown in preview mode.
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.5.3 (5be4091987a98e3870d89d630eb87be6d9bafd27, 2016-09-22T08:40:08.699Z)
- OS Version: Linux x64 4.4.0-38-generic

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Use the following snippet inside a markdown file (README.md):

| Method | Usage | Description |
| --- | --- | --- |
| ex<T> | test.ex<MyException>(lambda) | Check exception of type T is thrown. |
| ex_not<T> | test.ex_not<int>(lambda) | Check exception of type T not thrown. |
| ex_any | test.ex_any(lambda) | Check any exception is thrown. |
| ex_none | test.ex_none(lambda) | Check no exception is thrown. |
1. Press Shift+Ctrl+V to preview markdown, notice the < > brackets are missing. So far I've notice this is only broken for tables.

When I view this markdown README.md file online in BitBucket the angle bracket are shown correctly.

data.title: Format complex command descriptions for better generated Markdown.
data.body:
The last couple of releases I had been manually reformatting the generated API complex commands topic (vscode-api-commands.md). 
This PR Markdown'ifies the command descriptions (use spaces not tabs for indentation, add bullet points).

data.title: [json] Completions provided in json comments
data.body:
[JSON doest not allow comments](http://stackoverflow.com/questions/244777/can-comments-be-used-in-json) but [some json](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/blob/master/.vscode/launch.json#L98-L102) in the vscode repo itself uses comments. I'm unsure what the expected editing experience should be in this case, but perhaps it is worth clarifying a bit. The colorization should clarify that comments are forbidden, or allow them. If it is the latter, its is counter-intuitive that comments behave like normal json, and offer auto-completion.

In any event, text inside (illegal) comments triggers autocompletion.

![json_completion](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3226984/18768411/d1795e78-80d9-11e6-8e03-2051a3d6f692.PNG)
- VSCode Version: 1.5.3 (commit 5be409)
- OS Version: Win10
  Steps to Reproduce:
1.  Open a *.json file
2.  Type a comment.
3. Type a non-whitespace character in the comment (eg: ':')
4. Observe completions

data.title: User Defined Snippets Issue
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.5.3 (5be4091987a98e3870d89d630eb87be6d9bafd27, 2016-09-22T08:50:42.185Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 10.0.10586

I have the following user defined snippet:

`"MyInput": {
        "prefix": "MyInput",
        "body": [
            "<input type=${Type} name=${Name} id=${Name} value=${Value}>"
        ],
        "description": "Enters a full input tag into code."
    }`

The first time I try to use the snippet by typing "MyInput" and hitting `TAB` I experience an issue once I start to type in the "type" of input it is.  The same thing happens for any user defined snippet that I have created so I'm thinking that either my snippets are coded incorrectly or there is some type of glitch.  Instead of getting "text" when I hit the `TAB` key I get `<text></text>`.  If I undo my typing and then type `myinp` all over again and tab through the process, I get the desired result.

Language for demonstration purposes is basic HTML.

Please watch the video inserted below:

![2016-09-22_15-42-23](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6462859/18765619/1f8efc9c-80dc-11e6-860c-e2fe009323d5.gif)

data.title: Insiders: cat.exe won't start, MSVCP140.dll is missing
data.body:
- VSCode Version:1.6.0 insiders
- OS Version:Windows 7

Steps to Reproduce:
1. "code-insiders ."

Windows dialog box appears title "cat.exe - System Error" and message "The program can't start because MSVCP140.dll is missing from your computer. Try reinstalling the program to fix this problem."

After clearing the dialog box, code-insiders appears to work fine.

Not sure why cat.exe is included in code-insiders and called in code-insiders.cmd.  This started after applying some Windows updates.

data.title: Request: Command to select find matches
data.body: It would be nice to be able to have a command to select found matches; e.g. suppose you want to find a regex. This request would add a command that would actually select the matches (instead of just highlighting them).

data.title: Wrong German translation of "Open Editors"
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.5.3
- OS Version: OSX 10.11.6

The German translation of vscode has a similar issue to the ones described in #12478 where the translator obviously hadn't enough context.

The explorer "Open Editors" heading was interpreted as a verb by the translator and therefor translated to "Editoren Öffnen" which means something along the lines of "to open editors" or "open the editors". A better translation would be "Offene Editoren".

data.title: Weird or wrong translations in Spanish locale
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.5.3
- OS Version: 10

Some spanish localizations are "weird" according to MS standards, or even wrong. So far I've found these:
- "**About**" > currently "**Sobre**", usual MS string on other products: "**Acerca de...**". 
- "**Format code**" (right click menu), currently "**Código de formato**". The translator interpreted "**Format**" as a name, not as a verb. Looks like a direct translation from a translation tool. Right translation would be "**Dar formato al código**".
- Right click menu , "**Cambiar todas las repeticiones**", should be "**Cambiar todas las ocurrencias**".

All the rest seems to be fair accurate.
